messages.content: On 8th June 2017 vote David Meacock to scrap HS2 and elect an MP who lives in the Chesham & Amersham Constituency.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: David Meacock is committed to scrapping HS2, a project which he believes has local opposition and negative effects on the community.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Conservative colleagues: 'The secretary of state [Cheryl Gillan MP] did her job as a Welsh Secretary and as a constituency MP in talking to me about the benefits of the project.'
mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for any party other than UKIP will again be interpreted as a vote FOR HS2.

issues.health: There is no issue which will affect the quality of your daily life, and the health of local youngsters, more than HS2.

community.content: Given all the likely resulting problems from 7 years of HS2 construction dust and diesel air pollution, with even more potholes caused by lorries trundling over our already crumbling roads.

leaflet.personalStatement: Born in 1966, I have lived in Chalfont St Peter since the age of 3. Married to Kate in 2005, our children go to one of the local state schools I attended. I am a classical musician - pianist, conductor, solo tenor and I teach piano locally. My leafleting invention won Best New Business in the 2017 Bucks SME Business Awards. Passionate about politics since schooldays, I served you as a Chiltern District Councillor 1999-2015 and as a County Councillor 2001-09. During this time I organised a petition of over 8K singers and instrumentalists which played a major part in having detrimental to many voluntary-run organisations church licensing proposals withdrawn from the Licensing Act 2003. I upgraded to UKIP in 2013 disillusioned that the Conservative Party had deserted their core values of economic and protecting the Greenbelt, as manifested by HS2 and, contrary to expectations introduced. Local councillors folding powers, reducing local controls and accountability.

politicalExperience.achievements: Organised a petition of over 8K singers and instrumentalists which played a major part in having detrimental to many voluntary-run organisations church licensing proposals withdrawn from the Licensing Act 2003.

quotes.text: 'The [General] election result was a massive vote of confidence in favour of HS2.'
quotes.source: Transport Minister, now Conservative Party Chairman The Rt. Hon. Sir Patrick McLoughlin MP

examples: 90% of Conservative Lib-Dem & Labour MP's have repeatedly voted FOR HS2 Enabling Acts of Parliament.
I attended a classical musician - pianist, conductor, solo tenor and I teach piano locally.
Vote for any party other than UKIP will again be interpreted as a vote FOR HS2.
There is no issue which will affect the quality of your daily life, and the health of local youngsters, more than HS2.
Given all the likely resulting problems from 7 years of HS2 construction dust and diesel air pollution, with even more potholes caused by lorries trundling over our already crumbling roads.
90% of Conservative Lib-Dem & Labour MP's have repeatedly voted FOR HS2 Enabling Acts of Parliament.

examples: Even the Greenbelt is being reviewed with a view to building on it, and PM May has recently reaffirmed her commitment to HS2.
'The general election result was a massive vote of confidence in favour of HS2.' - said by Transport Minister, now Conservative Party Chairman The Rt. Hon. Sir Patrick McLoughlin MP, June 2015.
90% of Conservative Lib-Dem & Labour MP's have repeatedly voted FOR HS2 Enabling Acts of Parliament.
The secretary of state [Cheryl Gillan MP] did her job as a Welsh Secretary and as a constituency MP in talking to me about the benefits of the project.
